singleTweet.text: Observers in Europe and Africa will witness the lunar disappearing act on the night of July 16, with the most dramatic part of the eclipse arriving at 21:31 UT https://t.co/OURfQgVFXd

singleTweet.text: 14:54 The spacecraft is traveling at 12,914 feet per second and is about 22,000 nautical miles from Earth. #Apollo50th

singleTweet.author: @NatGeo
singleTweet.text: 14:38 The third rocket stage has dumped its leftover fuel, which allowed it to be fired into a long solar orbit so that it's not in Apollo 11's path. #Apollo50th https://t.co/CUGpti7fCb

singleTweet.text: Previously dethroned, Hawaii's Mauna Loa has once again been handed the title of the largest single volcano on Earth https://t.co/AO9j3tB123
